title: How did Sandy Ratcliff die and who did she play in EastEnders?
text:
Sandy Ratcliff starred in EastEnders for three years (Picture: Don Smith/Radio Times/Getty)

Former EastEnders star Sandy Ratcliff passed away after taking an excessive amount of morphine while suffering two terminal lung conditions.

The 70-year-old died on April 7 in her sheltered accommodation near her flat in Stoke Newington, London.

She was survived by her son William Palmer whom she had with theatre director Terence Palmer.

How did Sandy Ratcliff die?

Ms Ratcliff’s cause of death was given as ‘bronchopneumonia and morphine toxicity as a result of a malignant lung tumour and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease’, reports the BBC..

The inquest at Poplar’s Coroners Court heard the actress had been discharged from hospital the day before her death and had been given morphine for pain relief.

The actress was part of the original soap cast (Picture: United News/Popperfoto/Getty)

William said his mother had suffered three strokes in the years leading up to her death – the first in 2013 – which left her with a pain in her arm.

Ms Ratcliff was prescribed codeine as relief however reportedly would take more than advised for both pain management and ‘recreational use’.

By October 2018, her condition began to worsen and while she was seen by GPs on numerous occasions, she had declined an admission to hospital.

She was finally persuaded to go to hospital for treatment for a lung infection in April, after which she was discharged and her prescription of codeine was changed to morphine.

The pathologist at the inquest said the level of morphine found in her blood was within the therapeutic range, while the corner concluded Mr Ratcliff was ‘near to the end’ when she was admitted into hospital.

EastEnders actor Nejdet Salih at the time of her death (Photo: Don Smith/Radio Times/Getty)

Who did Sandy Ratcliff play in EastEnders?

Ms Ratcliff was as one of the soap’s original cast members, and played café owner Sue Osman from its very first episode in 1985 until 1989.

At the time of her death EastEnders co-star Nejdet Salih – who played her onscreen husband – praised the star as an actress and a mother.

He said: ‘I remember the first time I auditioned for the show, we had this instant chemistry and banter.

‘We had a lot of fun on the show and some really good storylines.

He added: ‘[Ms Ratcliff] was a great mum. There was nothing she wouldn’t do for William. She would try to take younger actors under her wing and had a great sense of humour.’
